result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher B Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher B Wagner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher B Wagner
Current: 2706 Pheasant Ridge Trl  #7, Madison, WI 53713 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2016)
Prior: 820 Harris St Apt B, Princeton, WI 54968

8:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to DC will recommend a fine plus costs, will dismiss the domestic enhancer and will dismiss and read-in count 2.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1. Court strikes the domestic enhancer and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  $150 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Court orders the $150 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs.  Court orders the defendant to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:01 p.m.

9:54 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney, will represent himself.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for status hearing on July 27, 2015 at 8:45 a.m.  Defendant to make an appointment with the DA's office.

Court adjourned at 9:56 a.m.
No Violent Contact with Lydia H.
No Violent Contact with Lydia H.

2:01 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $150.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Lydia H.  Court will set for Status Hearing on Status Hearing on July 14, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:02 p.m.
